title: Release of Items/Product
description: Systematic procedures for product release, handling of hold and rejected items, and managing customer food safety complaints and feedback

requirements.text: Is there a documented product release procedure available?
mandatoryStatements: Product release procedure is documented
Release criteria are clearly defined (testing, inspection, documentation review)
Responsible personnel for product release are identified
Procedure requires verification of all food safety requirements before release
Hold and quarantine procedures are included
Positive release system ensures only approved product is released
Emergency release procedures are defined if applicable
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of product release procedure for adequacy, quarterly verification that releases follow procedure
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Pre-release verification for each lot/batch, immediate documentation of release decision

requirements.text: Are there records of product releases kept on file?
mandatoryStatements: Product release records are maintained for all lots/batches
Records document date of release, lot/batch identifier, and authorizing person
Records show all release criteria were met (test results, inspections, etc.)
Traceability from product to release record is maintained
Records are organized and retrievable
Records are retained per record retention procedure
Release records support product traceability and recall capability
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual audit of release records for completeness, quarterly verification of record organization and traceability
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate documentation at time of release, weekly review of release record completeness

requirements.text: Is there a documented procedure for handling on hold and rejected items?
mandatoryStatements: Procedure for handling hold and rejected items is documented
Segregation and identification requirements are specified
Physical controls to prevent unintended use or release are defined
Evaluation and disposition process is described
Authority for disposition decisions is identified
Disposal, rework, or downgrade options are specified
Documentation requirements for disposition are defined
Notification requirements (to customers, suppliers, regulators) are included if applicable
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of hold/reject procedure, quarterly verification that segregated items are properly identified and controlled
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate segregation upon identification of non-conforming product, daily verification of physical controls

requirements.text: Are there records of the handling of on hold and rejected items kept on file?
mandatoryStatements: Records are maintained for all items placed on hold or rejected
Records document reason for hold/rejection, date, and quantity
Investigation and evaluation results are documented
Disposition decision and justification are recorded
Authority for disposition is documented (signature or electronic approval)
Final handling (disposal, rework, downgrade, release) is recorded
Records support traceability of non-conforming product
Trend analysis of holds/rejections is performed to identify systemic issues
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual audit of hold/reject records, quarterly review of disposition compliance and trend analysis
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate documentation when items are placed on hold, weekly review of open holds for timely resolution

requirements.text: Is there a documented procedure for dealing with customer and buyer food safety complaints/feedback along with records and company responses, including corrective actions?
mandatoryStatements: Customer complaint procedure is documented
Procedure covers receipt, documentation, and acknowledgment of complaints
Food safety complaints are prioritized and escalated appropriately
Investigation methodology is defined
Root cause analysis is required for food safety complaints
Corrective and preventive actions are implemented
Customer communication and response procedures are specified
Complaint records include: complaint details, investigation results, corrective actions, and customer response
Trend analysis of complaints is conducted
Lessons learned are incorporated into food safety system improvements
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual audit of complaint handling procedure and records, quarterly trend analysis of complaints
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate acknowledgment of food safety complaints, timely investigation (within 24-48 hours), monthly review of open complaints

capaInject: If product released without meeting criteria: immediate recall assessment, investigate release failure, implement enhanced verification within 7 days
If release records incomplete or missing: reconstruct records if possible, implement checklist system to ensure completeness
If hold/rejected items not properly segregated: immediate physical segregation, investigate control failure, enhance identification system
If customer food safety complaint not properly investigated: immediate investigation, customer communication within 24 hours, corrective action within specified timeframe
traceabilityInject: Product release records must trace from lot/batch to all supporting test results and inspection records
Hold and rejection records must trace from identification through final disposition
Customer complaint records must trace from complaint receipt through investigation, corrective action, and customer response
All disposition decisions must be traceable to authorized personnel and supporting evaluation data
